oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: A Word With The Great Ones - Army Recruiting Service interviews - Grand Ole Opry
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of interviews with Stu Phillips (performer), The Four Guys (performers), and Jim Ed Brown (performer), recorded for Army Recruiting Service backstage at the Grand Ole Opry.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement -- [Unidentified] introduces and gives some highlights on Stu Phillips -- Women's Army Core commercial advertisement -- Lt. Don Hetzler introduces Stu Phillips -- Stu Phillips talks about coming from Canada to Nashville and his adjustment experience -- Stu Phillips talks about working hard and making sacrifices -- Phillips talks about not having served the U. S. Military due to being a Canadian citizen, but he enjoys traveling to U. S. bases around the world and performing for the troops -- Phillips talks about his acting career being secondary to music -- Opening statement -- [Unidentified] talks about the Grand Ole Opry and introduces The Four Guys -- Women's Army Core commercial advertisement -- Lt. Don Hetzler introduces Burl Lions of The Four Guys -- Lions talks about his service in the U. S. Army battalion -- Lions compares his nerves when performing on stage to jumping out of a plane -- Hetzler introduces the rest of the Four Guys -- Brent talks about continuing their success in music -- Closing theme -- Opening statement -- [Unidentified] introduces Jim Ed Brown -- U. S. Army commercial advertisement -- Lt. Hetzler introduces Jim Ed Brown -- Brown talks about the behind the scenes people involved in the country music industry -- Brown talks about the varying success of some of his released -- Brown talks about recording in different countries -- Brown talks about his army service -- Hetzler concludes the interview -- Closing theme
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Grand Ole Opry House (Nashville, Tenn.); Brown, Jim Ed, 1934-2015; The Four Guys; Phillips, Stu;
